alert.note: Alert for Knox; Sevier (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 10 at 6:40AM CDT until August 10 at 8:45AM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of east Tennessee, including the following counties, Grainger, Jefferson, Knox and Sevier. * WHEN...Until 915 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 738 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms had ended but light to moderate rain may continue for next few hours. Minor flooding is ongoing in the advisory area. Between 1.0 and 2 inches of rain has fallen in the last couple hours. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Knoxville, Sevierville, Jefferson City, Gatlinburg, Dandridge, Pigeon Forge, New Market, Strawberry Plains, Blaine, Pittman Center, Kodak, Piedmont, McMahan, Harrisburg, Fairgarden, Kimberlin Heights, Bird Crossing, Seymour, Chestnut Hill and Mascot. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
